facts.text: Sri Lanka is known as the 'Pearl of the Indian Ocean' due to its natural beauty and rich cultural heritage.
Sri Lanka has eight UNESCO World Heritage Sites, including the ancient city of Polonnaruwa and the sacred city of Kandy.
Sri Lanka is home to the world's oldest human-planted tree, the Sri Maha Bodhi in Anuradhapura, which is over 2,000 years old.
Sri Lanka has a rich history of arts and crafts, including traditional dance forms like Kandyan and Bharatanatyam.
Sri Lanka was the first country in the world to have a female Prime Minister, Sirimavo Bandaranaike, in 1960.
Sri Lanka is one of the world's largest tea exporters and is famous for its Ceylon Tea.
The Sri Lankan national flag is one of the oldest flags in the world, with its lion symbol dating back to 486 BC.
